utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Hi.

utterance.speaker: Clerk
utterance.content: Six dollars, please.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Six? I just had it for one night. It’s three.

utterance.speaker: Clerk
utterance.content: Eight o’clock is the cut-off and, aww, it’s 8:02.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Y'know in a weird way, you have too much power. Look, you’re gonna have to help me out here, ‘cause I only have three.

utterance.speaker: Richard
utterance.content: I can help with that.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Oh my God. Richard? Hi!

utterance.speaker: Richard
utterance.content: Hi!

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Wow! Your lip went bald. Hey, thanks.

utterance.speaker: Richard
utterance.content: So, you look great.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Right.

utterance.speaker: Richard
utterance.content: No you do. You... just...

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: What?

utterance.speaker: Richard
utterance.content: You’ve got panties stuck to your leg.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: That’s because I-I was just grabbing some things out of the dryer, and it’s static cling. Or maybe it’s just that God knew I’d be running into you and saw an opportunity.

utterance.speaker: Richard
utterance.content: It’s good to see you.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: It’s good to see you too.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: You see that guy? He’s in classics now, but y'know as soon as we leave he’s going straight to the porn.

utterance.speaker: Richard
utterance.content: He’s gonna go up to the counter with Citizen Kane, Vertigo, and Clockwork Orgy. This is nice.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Yeah.

utterance.speaker: Richard
utterance.content: I missed this.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Me too.

utterance.speaker: Richard
utterance.content: So, you wanna get a hamburger or something?

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Oh, um, I don’t know if that’s a good idea.

utterance.speaker: Richard
utterance.content: Oh. Look, just friends, I won’t grope you. I promise.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: No, I just I think that it’s too soon.

utterance.speaker: Richard
utterance.content: No it’s not too soon, I had lunch at a eleven.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Yeah, baby!

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: What are you doing?

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Making chocolate milk. Do you want some?

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: No thanks. I’m 29.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Oh my God, I gotta go to work!

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Oh sweetie, when do you think you’re going to get off tonight?

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Oh I don’t know honey. It’s gonna be really late.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Oh come on, not again.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: I know. I’m sorry. Look, I’ll make a deal with you all right? Okay?

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Hmm.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: For every night that you’re asleep before I get home from work...

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Yeah.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: I will wake you up in a way that’s proved very popular in the past.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Now, if you need to stay late, I want to be supportive of that.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Right.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Hi.

utterance.speaker: All
utterance.content: Hey.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Look at you. Since when do you roller blade?

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Oh! Since tomorrow. I met this really cute guy in the park and he like y'know, jogs, and blades, and swims, and so y'know we made a deal that’s he’s going to teach me all sorts of jock stuff.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: And what are you going to do for him?

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: I’m going to let him.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Okay.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Cool.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Morning.

utterance.speaker: All
utterance.content: Hey.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Somebody got in late last night.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Yeah well, I ran into Richard.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: When did this happen?

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Oh, um, around 8:02. We ah, talked for a little while, and then um, we went out for an innocent burger.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Oh, there’s no such thing as an innocent burger.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: So, are you gonna see him again?

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Tomorrow night.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Monica, what are you doing?

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Well, she spent the last six months getting over him, and now she’s celebrating that by going on a date with him.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: It’s not a date, okay. I’m just gonna teach him how to make lasagne for some pot luck dinner he has.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Well, you might wanna make a little extra, y'know you’ll probably be hungry after the sex.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: We’re not gonna have sex! Okay, nothing’s changed here. He still doesn’t want children and I still do, so that’s why we’re just gonna be friends.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Naked friends.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Hey.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Hey.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Do you have any ice?

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Check the freezer. If there’s none in there, then we’re probably out. Are you just getting in from work? It’s late.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Yeah, I know. I had the greatest day though, I got to sit in on the meeting with the reps from Calvin Klien. I told my boss I liked this line of lingerie, she ordered a ton of it. How was your day?

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: I discovered I’m able to count all of my teeth using just my tongue.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Hmm. Umm, why do you have a copy of The Shining in your freezer?

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Oh, I was reading it last night, and I got scared, so.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: But ah, you’re safe from it if it’s in the freezer?

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Well, safer. Y'know, I mean I never start reading The Shining, without making sure we’ve got plenty of room in the freezer, y'know.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: How often do you read it?

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Haven’t you ever read the same book over and over again?

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Well, umm, I guess I read Little Women more than once. But I mean that’s a classic, what’s so great about The Shining?

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: The question should be Rach, what is not so great about The Shining. Okay? And the answer would be: nothing. All right? This is like the scariest book ever. I bet it’s way better than that classic of yours.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Okay. Ah, well we’ll just see about that, okay. I will read The Shining, and you will read Little Women.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: All right, you got it.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: All right.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Okay.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Okay.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Ah, now Rach, these ah, these little women.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Yeah.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: How little are they? I mean, are they like scary little?

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Um, Chandler, Ross, this is Robert.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Oh, hey.

utterance.speaker: Robert
utterance.content: Hi.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Hey.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: You’ve have lipstick right here . That’s okay, it’s mine, we just kissed.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Oh.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: So ah, isn’t a bit cold out for shorts?

utterance.speaker: Robert
utterance.content: Well, I’m from California.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Right, right. Sometimes you guys just burst into flames.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: I’m up! I’m up, I’ve gotten up now! Anybody ah, want anything?

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: I’ll have coffee.

utterance.speaker: Robert
utterance.content: Yeah, me too.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Yeah, make that three.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Okay Ross, why don’t you come with me?

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Okay. What ah, what is the matter with you? What’s going on?

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Robert’s coming out.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: What, what do you mean, what? Is he gay?

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: No. He.....he’s coming out of his shorts.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: What?!

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: The man is showing brain.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Are you sure? Hold on. I’m sorry you guys, that was a coffee and a....

utterance.speaker: Robert
utterance.content: Coffee.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Okay.

utterance.speaker: Robert
utterance.content: We could write it down for you?

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: No, no, that won’t be ah, that won’t be necessary

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Wellll?

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Yeah, yeah, yeah!

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: What do we do? What do we do?

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Well, I suppose we just try to not look directly at it.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Like an eclipse.

utterance.speaker: Richard
utterance.content: So when people complement me on my cooking should I, what do I say?

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: You say ‘Thank you very much,’ and then you buy me something pretty. Come on, we’re gonna put are hands in this bowl, and we’re gonna start squishing the tomatoes.

utterance.speaker: Richard
utterance.content: Ew, this feels very weird.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: You touch people’s eyeballs every day and this feels weird.

utterance.speaker: Richard
utterance.content: Yeah, well, sure I touch them, but I spent years learning not to squish them. That’s my hand.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Oops.

utterance.speaker: Richard
utterance.content: Okay.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Gotta keep squishing.

utterance.speaker: Richard
utterance.content: Tomatoes are squishing.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Okay.

utterance.speaker: Richard
utterance.content: Op.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Oh, gosh, you got some on your shirt.

utterance.speaker: Richard
utterance.content: Yeah.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Hold on a second, just put a little club soda on it and it should umm, be.....

utterance.speaker: Richard
utterance.content: What?

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Umm, you’ve got some on your pants.

utterance.speaker: Richard
utterance.content: I’ll just throw them out.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: These little women. Wow!

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Your liking it, huh?

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Oh yeah! Amy just burned Jo’s manuscript. I don’t see how he could ever forgive her.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Umm, Jo’s a girl, it’s short for Josephine.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: But Jo’s got a crush on Laurie. Oh. You mean it’s like a girl-girl thing? ‘Cause that is the one thing missing from The Shining.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: No, actually Laurie’s a boy.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: No wonder Rachel had to read this so many times.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Hey!

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Hey.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Hey! How’d the ah, basketball go?

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Oh, okay, I learned how to shoot a lay-up, a foul shot, and a twenty-three pointer.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: You mean a three pointer?

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Oh, I get more because I’m dainty.

utterance.speaker: Robert
utterance.content: So um, is there a phone here, I can check my messages?

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Yeah, in the back. You want a quarter?

utterance.speaker: Robert
utterance.content: Oh, no thanks. I always carry one in my sock.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: What are you doing? Get back over on your side of the... Hello!! Hi, I’m Joey, we haven’t met.

utterance.speaker: Robert
utterance.content: Ah, good to meet you. Robert.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: What? What? You guys, what is going on? You not like Robert? Why are you laughing?!

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Calm down. There’s no reason to get testy.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: You guys!! Come on!

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: I’m sorry, I’m sorry, it just seems that Robert isn’t as concealed in the shorts area, as ah, one may have hoped.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: What do you mean?

utterance.speaker: Robert
utterance.content: Hey.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Hey.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Hey Robert, could you ah, ha, pass me those cookies?

utterance.speaker: Robert
utterance.content: Sure.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: So, how’d the lasagne go over? Really?! Good. So you owe me three pretty things. Yeah, I’ve been thinking a lot about you too. I know. It’s hard this whole platonic thing. It’s a word!

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Yeah, I do think it’s better this way. Yeah, we’re being smart. Yes, I’m sure.

utterance.speaker: Richard
utterance.content: You really sure?

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: I’ll call you back.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: So we can be friends who sleep together.

utterance.speaker: Richard
utterance.content: Absolutely, this will just be something we do, like racquetball.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Sounds smart and healthy to me. So um, just out of curiosity, um, do you currently have any other racquetball buddies?

utterance.speaker: Richard
utterance.content: Just your dad. Although that’s actually racquetball. You know I-I do have a blind date with my sister’s neighbour next Tuesday.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Oh.

utterance.speaker: Richard
utterance.content: You want me to cancel it?

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: No! No!

utterance.speaker: Richard
utterance.content: Okay.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: ‘Cause if you do that means you’d be cancelling it for me, and we’re just friends.

utterance.speaker: Richard
utterance.content: Exactly.

utterance.speaker: Robert
utterance.content: Hey.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Hey. Ooh! Don’t sit down!

utterance.speaker: Robert
utterance.content: You ready to go to the batting cage?

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Yeah. And, first here’s a gift.

utterance.speaker: Robert
utterance.content: Oh! Wow! Hey!

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Stretchy pants! Why, those are the greatest things in the world! If I were you I would wear them every day, every day!

utterance.speaker: Robert
utterance.content: Jeez, thank you really that is so nice. But um, to be honest, I don’t think I can wear these, they’re so tight, I feel like I’m on display. I’m sorry.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: That’s all right, that’s well, I figured....

utterance.speaker: Robert
utterance.content: Hey!

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Hey! How’s it going?

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Good.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Hey, Rach, how you doing with The Shining?

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Oh, Danny just went into room 217.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Oooh, the next part’s the best, when that dead lady in the bathtub...

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Oh, no, meh-nah-nah-nah, come on you’re gonna ruin it!

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: All right I’ll talk in code. Remember when the kid sees those two blanks in the hallway?

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Hmmm, that’s very cool.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Oh, all blank, and no blank, make’s blank a blank blank. Oh no-no-no, no, the end when Jack almost kills them all with that blank, but then at last second they get away. Aww!

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Joey! I can’t believe you just did that!

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: I can’t believe she cracked your code!

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: All right, okay, Laurie proposes to Jo, and she says no, even though she’s still in love with him, and then he ends up marring Amy.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Hey! Mine was by accident! All right, the boiler explodes and destroys the hotel, and kills the dad.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Eh. Beth dies.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Beth, Beth dies?

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Um-hmm.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Is that true? If I keep reading is Beth gonna die?

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: No, Beth doesn’t die, she doesn’t die. Does she Rachel?

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: What?!

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Joey’s asking if you’ve just ruined the first book he’s ever loved that didn’t star Jack Nicholson?

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: No. She doesn’t die.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Then why would you say that?!

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Because, I wanted to hurt you.

utterance.speaker: Robert
utterance.content: Oh, there they are! I-I dropped my keys.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Oh my....

utterance.speaker: Robert
utterance.content: Got ‘em.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Hi.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Sorry. I’m sorry.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: You would not believe my day! I had to work two shifts, and then to top it off, I lost one of my fake boobs, in a grill fire.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: What are you smiling at?

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: I’m sorry, I was just thinking you’re day could still pick up.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Yeah, right.

utterance.speaker: Richard
utterance.content: Hello.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: I love this friend thing!

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Listen, Robert’s gonna be here any second so, will one of you just tell him?

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Oh.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Please, right now, no, every time I see him it’s like ‘Is it on the lose?’ ‘Is it watching me?’

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: We can’t tell him, you can’t go up to a guy you barely know and talk about his.... stuff.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: He’s right, even if it’s to say something complementary.

utterance.speaker: Robert
utterance.content: Hey!

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Hey.

utterance.speaker: Robert
utterance.content: So are ready for the gym? They’ve got this new rock climbing wall, we can spot each other.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: No, I can spot you from here.

utterance.speaker: Robert
utterance.content: What?

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Okay, listen Robert...

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Hey, don’t we have to...

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Yeah, we got, um-hmm.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Umm, I think you’re really, really great...

utterance.speaker: Robert
utterance.content: Oh God! Here we go again. Why does this keep happening to me? Is it something I’m putting out there? Is this my fault? Or am I just nuts?

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: I-I-I-I-I don’t know, I don’t know what to say.

utterance.speaker: Gunther
utterance.content: Hey buddy, this is a family place, put the mouse back in the house.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Ow!

utterance.speaker: Richard
utterance.content: Really?! Well, it’s just like everyone else’s apartment. It’s got rooms, walls, and ceilings.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Oh my God! Oh my God!

utterance.speaker: Richard
utterance.content: Ah well, this is the living room.

utterance.speaker: Richard
utterance.content: All right. This is the kitchen.

utterance.speaker: Richard
utterance.content: The bedroom. Well it’s pretty much your typical... bedroom.

utterance.speaker: Richard
utterance.content: Um-hmm.

utterance.speaker: Richard
utterance.content: Oh shoot! Maybe next time. Thanks for a lovely evening.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: So um, who was she?

utterance.speaker: Richard
utterance.content: Oh, that was the blind date that I told you about, she called and switched it to today.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Did you like her? And I’m just asking as a friend, because I am totally fine with this.

utterance.speaker: Richard
utterance.content: Well, you seem fine.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Okay, y'know what, I’m not fine, I’m not. I mean how can I be fine, hearing you come in with her, she wants to see your bedroom.... Y'know what, what if we’re friends who don’t see other people?

utterance.speaker: Richard
utterance.content: You mean like exclusive friends?

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Why not?! I mean this has been the most amazing week. Would it be so terrible? Even if we were friends who lived together. Or, maybe someday friends who stood up in front of their other friends, and vowed to be friends forever.

utterance.speaker: Richard
utterance.content: Wow. Y'know we’re back where we were. Honey, I would love to do all that, but nothing’s changed.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: That’s not true, you don’t have a moustache.

utterance.speaker: Richard
utterance.content: Okay, okay, one thing’s changed. But we still want different things and we know how this is gonna end.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Y'know what, I’ve got to walk out of here right now, ‘cause getting over you is the hardest thing that I have ever had to do. I don’t think I could do it again.

utterance.speaker: Richard
utterance.content: I know I couldn’t. So....

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: How ‘bout one last game of racquetball?

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Watch the thorns!

utterance.speaker: Richard
utterance.content: Ow!!

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: What?

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Beth is really, really sick.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Awwww.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Jo’s there, but I don’t think there’s anything she could do.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Joey?

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Yeah.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Do you want to put the book in the freezer?

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Okay.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Okay.
